text: The prime minister of Denmark (; literally "Minister of the State") is the head of government of the Kingdom of Denmark. The Constitution of 1849 established a constitutional monarchy by limiting the powers of the monarch and creating the office of the prime minister. The inaugural holder of the office was Adam Wilhelm Moltke. The appointment of the prime minister is determined by their support in the Folketing (The National Parliament). The current prime minister of Denmark is Mette Frederiksen. ==Living former Prime Ministers== File:Flickr - europeanpeoplesparty - EPP and PES PRESIDENTS DEBATE 21.01.2005 (21).jpg|Poul Nyrup Rasmussen born served 1993–2001 File:Former Danish Prime Minister Anders Fogh Rasmussen at the Nordic Council Session in Helsinki 2008-10-28.jpg|Anders Fogh Rasmussen born served 2001–09 File:Helle Thorning-Schmidt portrait.jpg|Helle Thorning-Schmidt born served 2011–15 File:Lars Løkke Rasmussen - 2018 (MUS6631) (cropped).jpg|Lars Løkke Rasmussen born served 2015–19 & 2009–11 ==References== ==Other websites== *The Prime Minister's Office () *Official Denmark Constitution, from the Royal Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs. *
title: Prime Minister of Denmark
